Storage

Class DataFile

  • Object
    • Storage.DataFile

  • public class DataFile
extends Object
    This class handles the logic involved in reading and writing of tasks to the system file, and managing tasks. Do not apply the singleton pattern to this class. Even if multiple instances are created, all task data in lists and on file will still be synchronized. For more details, view GitHub issue #64 (https://github.com/cs2103aug2014-t15-1j/main/issues/64).
    Author:
    Pierce Anderson Fu

    • Constructor Detail

      • DataFile

        public DataFile()
        Default constructor. Checks if file exists and task lists are not populated before reading from file, and populating lists with Task objects. If lists are already populated, it signals that other DataFile instances exist, and avoids populating the task lists with duplicate Task objects from file.

    • Method Detail

      • getToDoTasks

        public List<Task> getToDoTasks()
        Returns an unmodifiable view of the list of to-do tasks. Attempts to modify the returned list, whether direct or via its iterator, result in an UnsupportedOperationException. Exclusively contains undeleted to-do tasks.
        Returns:
        Unmodifiable view of the specified list.

      • getDoneTasks

        public List<Task> getDoneTasks()
        Returns an unmodifiable view of the list of done tasks. Attempts to modify the returned list, whether direct or via its iterator, result in an UnsupportedOperationException. Exclusively contains undeleted done tasks.
        Returns:
        Unmodifiable view of the specified list.

      • getDeletedTasks

        public List<Task> getDeletedTasks()
        Returns an unmodifiable view of the list of deleted tasks. Attempts to modify the returned list, whether direct or via its iterator, result in an UnsupportedOperationException. Exclusively contains deleted to-do and deleted done tasks.
        Returns:
        Unmodifiable view of the specified list.

      • getAllTasks

        public List<Task> getAllTasks()
        Returns an unmodifiable view of the list of all tasks. Attempts to modify the returned list, whether direct or via its iterator, result in an UnsupportedOperationException. Contains references to all Task objects in toDoTasks, doneTasks, and deletedTasks. Does not contain duplicate tasks.
        Returns:
        Unmodifiable view of the specified list.

      • getTask

        public Task getTask(int id)
        Given id, returns Task object. Includes to-do, done, and deleted tasks.
        Parameters:
        id - The task's unique ID.
        Returns:
        Task object of matching ID, or null if task is not in the list.

      • addNewTask

        public boolean addNewTask(Task task)
        Adds a new to-do task to lists and file. Populates relevant lists, and updates file with new information.
        Parameters:
        task - New Task object to be written to file.
        Returns:
        True, if successfully written to file.

      • updateTaskInfo

        public boolean updateTaskInfo(Task task,
                              String name,
                              String due,
                              String start,
                              String end,
                              List<String> tags)
        Updates Task object's attributes with provided arguments. Null arguments are provided for attributes that are not meant to be changed. Task to edit is specified by Task object provided in argument. Overloaded function.
        Parameters:
        task - Task object to modify.
        name - New description, if any.
        due - New due date and time, if any.
        start - New scheduled start date and time, if any.
        end - New scheduled end date and time, if any.
        tags - New tags to append with, if any.
        Returns:
        True, if file has been successfully updated with edit.

      • updateTaskInfo

        public boolean updateTaskInfo(int id,
                              String name,
                              String due,
                              String start,
                              String end,
                              List<String> tags)
        Updates Task object's attributes with provided arguments, based on ID provided. Null arguments are provided for attributes that are not meant to be changed. Overloaded function.
        Parameters:
        id - ID of Task object to modify.
        name - New description, if any.
        due - New due date and time, if any.
        start - New scheduled start date and time, if any.
        end - New scheduled end date and time, if any.
        tags - New tags to append with, if any.
        Returns:
        True, if file has been successfully updated with edit.

      • deleteTask

        public boolean deleteTask(Task task)
        Deletes Task object provided in argument. Updates task lists and file. Overloaded function.
        Parameters:
        task - The Task object to delete.
        Returns:
        True, if file has been successfully updated with delete.

      • deleteTask

        public boolean deleteTask(int id)
        Deletes Task object based on the ID provided in argument. Updates task lists and file. Overloaded function.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the Task object to delete.
        Returns:
        True, if file has been successfully updated with delete.

      • restoreTask

        public boolean restoreTask(Task task)
        Restores deleted Task object provided in argument. Updates task lists and file. Overloaded function.
        Parameters:
        task - The Task object to restore.
        Returns:
        True, if file has been successfully updated with restore.

      • restoreTask

        public boolean restoreTask(int id)
        Restores deleted Task object based on the ID provided in argument. Updates task lists and file. Overloaded function.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the Task object to restore.
        Returns:
        True, if file has been successfully updated with restore.

      • wipeTask

        public boolean wipeTask(Task task)
        Permanently deletes Task object provided in argument. Cannot be undone. Used when undoing add commands. Decrements Task ID counter. Updates task lists and file. Overloaded function.
        Parameters:
        task - The Task object to permanently delete.
        Returns:
        True, if file has been successfully updated with wipe.

      • wipeTask

        public boolean wipeTask(int id)
        Permanently deletes Task object based on the ID provided in argument. Cannot be undone. Used when undoing add commands. Decrements Task ID counter. Updates task lists and file. Overloaded function.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the Task object to permanently delete.
        Returns:
        True, if file has been successfully updated with wipe.

      • wipeFile

        public boolean wipeFile()
        Permanently deletes all tasks in all lists, and clears file of data. Cannot be undone. User should be prompted for confirmation before executing this function.
        Returns:
        True, if successfully cleared file of data.

      • toDoTask

        public boolean toDoTask(Task task)
        Marks Task object provided in argument as to-do. If Task was deleted, restore it, and mark as to-do. Updates task lists and file. Overloaded function.
        Parameters:
        task - The Task object to be marked as to-do.
        Returns:
        True, if file has been successfully updated with change.

      • toDoTask

        public boolean toDoTask(int id)
        Marks Task object based on ID provided in argument as to-do. If Task was deleted, restore it, and mark as to-do. Updates task lists and file. Overloaded function.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the Task object to be marked as to-do.
        Returns:
        True, if file has been successfully updated with change.

      • doneTask

        public boolean doneTask(Task task)
        Marks Task object provided in argument as done. If Task was deleted, restore it, and mark as done. Updates task lists and file. Overloaded function.
        Parameters:
        task - The Task object to be marked as done.
        Returns:
        True, if file has been successfully updated with change.

      • doneTask

        public boolean doneTask(int id)
        Marks Task object based on ID provided in argument as done. If Task was deleted, restore it, and mark as done. Updates task lists and file. Overloaded function.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the Task object to be marked as done.
        Returns:
        True, if file has been successfully updated with change.
